law.catch_line: Criminal possession of a medical record -- Penalties.

text.section:
A person is guilty of criminal possession of a medical record when he or she possesses a medical record with the intent to unlawfully obtain a controlled substance by:
Falsifying, altering, or creating a medical record; or
Selling or unlawfully transferring the medical record to another person.
Any person who violates any subsection of this section shall be guilty of a Class D felony for the first offense and a Class C felony for a second or subsequent offense.

law.history: Created 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 124, sec. 5, effective June 26, 2007.
